banner.text: Please plug in a Motion sensor for this challenge
Let's use the power of code to make a pig fly!
Let's set the scene by drawing the sky, open the Draw tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change a blue color like #33ccff

We'll use a sticker for the pig.
Open the parts drawer by clicking here.

tooltips.text: Click on Sticker to add it to your app

banner.text: Now let's change it into a pig, open the Sticker tray
This block changes the sticker, drag it onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change Bee to Pig
Now let's re-position it, pen the Sticker tray
This block moves the sticker, drag it onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change 0 to 400 to move the pig to the right side of the canvas
Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change 0 to 250 to move the pig to the bottom right corner of the canvas
We need a loop to make it move, open the Control tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change seconds to frames
Now let's make that pig fly, open the Sticker tray
This block moves a sticker forward, drag it onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Open the Variables tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change 0 to -2 so it moves to the left
Look at it go! Now let's steer it with the Motion Sensor
Open the Sticker tray
This block rotates a sticker, drag it onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Let's use a lerp block to tweak the sensor value, open the Math tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change 200 to 10 to make the pig spin slower
Now to hook up the Motion Sensor, open the Motion tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Move your hand over the sensor and steer the pig. Next we'll make the pig a sky writer
Open the Draw tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Let's use the position of the pig to draw a smoke trail, open the Sticker tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Open the Sticker tray for the y position
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
We need shift the pen to the middle of the pig, open the Draw tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change 5 to 50 because the pig is about 100 pixels wide
Change 5 to 50
Let's choose a color for the smoke, open the Draw tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Choose a color for the smoke like #ffffff or #ff8ad8
Now to draw the smoke, open the Draw tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Steer the pig around again we have smoke! But it's not very smokey lets fix that
We'll use move and random to make a smokey effect, open the Draw tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Now to use random blocks, open the Math tray
This block chooses a random number every time, drag it onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change 0 to -5
Change 10 to 5
Grab another random block, open the Math tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Change 0 to -5
Change 10 to 5
Finally let's draw more smoke, open the Draw tray
Drag the block onto your code space
Connect it to this block
Steer the pig around again, you can really see how random makes it look like smoke plumes
Can you make the pig fly faster?
